page.title: 19 Traditional Music in Keith
page.content: An Accordion and Fiddle Club is held in the Royal Hotel on a Tuesday night each month.The aim of the Club is to foster interest in traditional Scottish music played on the fiddle and accordion. Young players are encouraged to take part and many have gone on to become Scottish Champions on their instrument. Well known Scottish musicians make guest appearances at the Club and in summer,many tourists come to listen to the music of Scotland. A Folk Club is also held on a monthly basis in the Plough Inn.At this Club, there is more emphasis on folk singing although traditional music is also featured.Many folk songs have been written about life in the N.E. of Scotland.These songs are known as "Bothy Ballads" and were often sung by farm workers in the evenings after a hard days work in the fields.
